1123389823916617728.text: Here's the outrageous moment where I tell Klonick that I respect her views, but I think they are wrong. Kate Klonick is a fun scholar because she's explicit and reasonably honest about welcoming private governance. Mild observations about how this might be problematic are, well..pic.twitter.com/raZ0Vpxgt5

1123390270794604544.text: Her response, as far as I remember it, was that my characterization of her point was only part of her argument. Not that I was wrong. Anyway, sorry to deluge you guys with this insider-y spat, just want to set the record straight before an outrage-a-thon starts.pic.twitter.com/GuCBqO8j2T

1123387590508515328.text: No, what's happening is Kate Klonick had been trading access to Facebook insiders for a critical lens and academics were catching on. I'll show you exactly her reaction to what was a respectful and mild critique of shoddy work. https://twitter.com/alexstamos/status/1122991688408944640 …
